turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Mathematics education in the United States.
turn.1: What year does most of the US high school population take Algebra?
turn.2: , intermediate algebra has been a high school level course.
turn.3: Are most high schools able to teach the Common Core?
turn.4: The Common Core mathematical standards recognizes both the sequential as well as integrated approach to teaching high-school mathematics, which resulted in increased adoption of integrated math programs for high school.
turn.5: What are the effects of Common Core?
turn.6: Accordingly, the organizations providing post-secondary education updated their enrollment requirements.
turn.8: For example, University of California requires three years of "college-preparatory mathematics that include the topics covered in elementary and advanced algebra and two- and three-dimensional geometry" to be admitted.
turn.9: Can you tell me more about the effects on higher education?
turn.10: After California Department of Education adopted Common Core, the University of California clarified that "approved integrated math courses may be used to fulfill part or all" of this admission requirement.
turn.11: What else can you tell me about the effects of Common Core?
turn.12: The above three-course sequence is followed by a course often called pre-calculus for college-bound students.
